articles.headline: Barr Asks Apple to Unlock Pensacola Killer’s Phones, Setting Up Clash
articles.snippet: The request set up a collision between law enforcement and big technology firms in the latest battle over privacy and security.
articles.abstract: The request set up a collision between law enforcement and big technology firms in the latest battle over privacy and security.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Attorney General William P. Barr declared on Monday that a deadly shooting last month at a naval air station in Pensacola, Fla., was an act of terrorism, and he asked Apple in an unusually high-profile request to provide access to two phones used by the gunman.

articles.headline: Iran’s Grim Economy Limits Its Willingness to Confront the U.S.
articles.snippet: Fearful of public anger over a plunging economy, Iran’s leaders appear to be turning inward, pulling back from escalation.
articles.abstract: Fearful of public anger over a plunging economy, Iran’s leaders appear to be turning inward, pulling back from escalation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Iran is caught in a wretched economic crisis. Jobs are scarce. Prices for food and other necessities are skyrocketing. The economy is rapidly shrinking. Iranians are increasingly disgusted.

articles.headline: Oyo Scales Back as SoftBank-Funded Companies Retreat
articles.snippet: The Indian hospitality start-up is losing hotel rooms and has stepped back from more than 200 cities as part of a broader pullback by firms financed by SoftBank.
articles.abstract: The Indian hospitality start-up is losing hotel rooms and has stepped back from more than 200 cities as part of a broader pullback by firms financed by SoftBank.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — Oyo, once one of India’s fastest-growing tech start-ups, is now rapidly scaling back.
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel, Karan Deep Singh and Erin Griffith

articles.headline: Russians Hacked Ukrainian Gas Company at Center of Impeachment
articles.snippet: The timing and scale of the attacks suggest the Russians may be looking for the same kind of damaging information on Joe Biden that President Trump wanted from Ukraine, security experts say.
articles.abstract: The timing and scale of the attacks suggest the Russians may be looking for the same kind of damaging information on Joe Biden that President Trump wanted from Ukraine, security experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: With President Trump facing an impeachment trial over his efforts to pressure Ukraine to investigate former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and his son Hunter Biden, Russian military hackers have been boring into the Ukrainian gas company at the center of the affair, according to security experts.
articles.byline: By Nicole Perlroth and Matthew Rosenberg

articles.headline: BlackRock C.E.O. Larry Fink: Climate Crisis Will Reshape Finance
articles.snippet: In his influential annual letter to chief executives, Mr. Fink said his firm would avoid investments in companies that “present a high sustainability-related risk.”
articles.abstract: In his influential annual letter to chief executives, Mr. Fink said his firm would avoid investments in companies that “present a high sustainability-related risk.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink, the founder and chief executive of BlackRock, announced Tuesday that his firm would make investment decisions with environmental sustainability as a core goal.

articles.headline: Documents Provide New Details of Trump’s Pressure Campaign on Ukraine
articles.snippet: The dozens of pages of notes, text messages and other records lay out work conducted by Rudolph W. Giuliani and an associate on behalf of the president.
articles.abstract: The dozens of pages of notes, text messages and other records lay out work conducted by Rudolph W. Giuliani and an associate on behalf of the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — New details emerged on Tuesday of President Trump’s pressure campaign on Ukraine, intensifying demands on Senate Republicans on the eve of a historic impeachment trial to include witness testimony and additional documents in the proceeding.

articles.headline: Trump’s Impeachment Trial a Perilous Duty for Chief Justice
articles.snippet: Chief Justice John Roberts’s role at an impeachment trial may be mostly ceremonial, but signs of partisanship could damage the Supreme Court.
articles.abstract: Chief Justice John Roberts’s role at an impeachment trial may be mostly ceremonial, but signs of partisanship could damage the Supreme Court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. walks out of his chambers at the Supreme Court, crosses First Street and enters the Capitol to preside over President Trump’s impeachment trial, he will leave behind an institution that prides itself on reason and decorum and enter one marked by partisan warfare.
